title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: KORA Response re: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Mr. Sinyangwe,

The appropriate email address for these requests is either sheriffrecords@sedgwick.gov<mailto:sheriffrecords@sedgwick.gov> or KORA-FIO@sedgwick.gov<mailto:KORA-FIO@sedgwick.gov>
The Finance Division, who you originally sent this to, cannot respond to your request.

I am forwarding to Sheriff Records. If you do not receive a response within three (3) business days, please let me know so I can troubleshoot.

[cid:image001.png@01DC9062.BA4C4E70]

Jennifer Scriven, MA | Records Manager & Freedom of Information Officer | Sedgwick County Department of Central Services

communications.subject: RE: KORA Response re: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Mr. Sinyangwe,

The Sedgwick County Sheriff's Office is in receipt of your request via email on January 28, 2026 in which you have requested:


"Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs."

The exact information that you are requesting are not specific records that are maintained by the Sedgwick County Sheriff's Office.

K.S.A. 45-217(l)(1)(A)  defines "Public record" to mean any recorded information, regardless of form, characteristics or location, which is made, maintained, or kept by or is in possession of a public agency.
There's nothing in KORA that compels a public agency to create a Public Record in response to a request.

If a record is not yet in existence, it is not "recorded information" as of the date of the request is not a public record.

Therefore, please find the information that we do track attached for the years requested..

Please let us know if we can be of further assistance.



                 Teresa McCabe
KORA Compliance Specialist|Special Projects Unit|Sedgwick County Sheriff's Office
p: (316) 660-3788 | f: (316) 660-3783 | teresa.mccabe@sedgwick.gov<mailto:teresa.mccabe@sedgwick.gov>
141 W. Elm St. | Wichita, KS 67203 | www.sedgwickcounty.org<http://www.sedgwickcounty.org/> | Facebook<http://www.facebook.com/sedgwickcounty> |

title: FOIA Request: ALPR Audit

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: FOIA Request: ALPR Audit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.	Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency. 

2.	Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System. 

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a researcher affiliated with an educational or noncommercial scientific institution (The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill), and this request is made for a scholarly or scientific purpose and not for commercial use. Therefore, I request a waiver of all fees for this request. 

If you deny any portion, or all, of this request, please provide me with a written explanation of the reason(s) for your denial, including a citation to each specific statutory exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. If you conclude that portions of the records that I request are exempt from disclosure, please release the remainder of such records for inspection and copying, redacting only the portion or portions that you claim are exempt.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Torin Monahan

communications.communication:
This message responds to your request for (1) the Flock Organization Audit and (2) the Flock Network Audit reports for the period June 1, 2024, through the date the request is processed.
After review, UNCP denies the request because the requested audit reports contain or would disclose ALPR-related data and query details that are confidential under North Carolina law. N.C.G.S. § 20-183.32(e) provides that captured plate data obtained in accordance with Article 3D is confidential and not a public record and limits disclosure to law enforcement for legitimate law enforcement purposes pursuant to a written request.
 
In addition, release of audit logs that identify querying personnel, agencies, and search details would constitute sensitive public security information, because it would reveal specific security practices used to prevent or respond to criminal activity and could jeopardize the safety of governmental personnel. See N.C.G.S. § 132-1.7(a)(4). For safety and security reasons and pursuant to the statutes cited above, we are withholding these records.

communications.subject: RE: North Carolina Public Records Law Request #2145603
communications.communication:
I greatly appreciate your taking the time to send me this response. I respectfully appeal the denial of my Freedom of Information Act request for records generated by or related to the use of Flock Safety automated license plate reader (ALPR) systems. 

To clarify, the documents that I am requesting need not include any captured plate data and are therefore not exempt under § 20-183.32. The spreadsheet column containing license plate data could simply be redacted or deleted.

The denial also cites exemption “(4) Specific security information or detailed plans, patterns, or practices to prevent or respond to criminal, gang, or organized illegal activity.” This exemption does not justify a blanket withholding of the requested records for the reasons explained below.

1. The requested records are observational data, not security plans or tactics

ALPR records consist of images of license plates, time stamps, and general location data captured passively in public spaces. Courts have consistently held that records documenting what the government observes in public do not constitute sensitive security plans, tactics, or operational details merely because the data may later be used in law enforcement investigations.

My request does not seek:

- System configurations, camera placement strategies, or technical vulnerabilities
- Real-time access to ALPR feeds
- Tactical deployment plans or investigative methodologies

Instead, it seeks historical records already collected, which do not reveal how the agency prevents or responds to criminal activity.

2. The exemption must be narrowly construed and cannot support categorical denial

FOIA exemptions are to be narrowly construed, and the agency bears the burden of demonstrating that disclosure would reasonably be expected to cause harm protected by the exemption. A generalized assertion that ALPR data relates to crime prevention is insufficient.

If the mere fact that data could be used for law enforcement were enough to trigger this exemption, then virtually all records held by law enforcement agencies would be categorically exempt—an outcome inconsistent with the purpose and letter of FOIA.

3. Disclosure of historical ALPR data does not compromise security

The requested records are historical in nature. Disclosure of past ALPR captures does not reveal current patrol patterns, response protocols, or vulnerabilities. Numerous jurisdictions release ALPR data in redacted form without compromising public safety, demonstrating that disclosure can be accomplished responsibly.

4. FOIA requires segregation and partial disclosure

Even if the agency believes that limited portions of the requested records could implicate protected security information, FOIA requires that all reasonably segregable, non-exempt portions be released. The denial does not identify any attempt to segregate or redact sensitive fields (e.g., investigative notes, active case identifiers) while releasing the remaining data.

A blanket denial without a segregability analysis violates FOIA’s statutory requirements.

5. Strong public interest in ALPR transparency

There is a significant public interest in understanding how ALPR technology is used, retained, shared, and accessed—particularly given its implications for privacy, civil liberties, and potential misuse. Transparency regarding the scope and scale of ALPR collection enhances public trust and accountability without impeding legitimate law enforcement functions.

***

For the reasons stated above, the cited exemption does not justify withholding the requested Flock ALPR records in their entirety. I respectfully request that the agency: 1) Reconsider its denial; 2) Conduct a proper segregability analysis; and 3) Release all non-exempt portions of the requested records, with narrowly tailored redactions if necessary.

If the denial is upheld, please provide a detailed explanation of how each withheld category of records specifically meets the claimed exemption, as required by FOIA.

Thank you for your consideration of this appeal.

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Livestock Care Standard Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all complaints filed with the Ohio Livestock Care Standards Board, between May 1st, 2025 and the date of response to this request. These complaints are submitted to OhioLivestockCare@agri.ohio.gov. 

I'm a journalist with the nonprofit newsroom Sentient. Any responsive documents will be used in reporting in the public interest, relating to safety of the U.S. food system and the welfare of farm animals.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: JPD sUAS Reports

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: JPD sUAS Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.  The Joplin Police Department's annual sUAS reports from 2017 to present.
2.  The location these reports are published


To provide context, we have reason to believe these records exist because the police department policy on use of sUAS devices states that an annual report shall be published. Policy located here. The relevant text is in paragraph 3 of section E:


3.  The Chief of Police or his or her designee shall publish an annual report documenting the agency’s deployment and use of sUAS devices.
    

We have been unable to locate these reports.

Since these reports are supposed to be easily accessible to the public we request the City waive all fees for this request. We request the City consider this request to waive fees despite the blanket policy of not waiving fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Security Assistance for Ukraine since January 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An itemized list of which elements of the Additional Security Assistance for Ukraine, announced January 9, 2025, were subsequently delivered to Ukraine, and in addition, which elements of previously-announced Ukraine Security Assistance under Presidential Drawdown Authority were subsequently delivered to Ukraine, since January 20, 2025. Please include the date on which each element was delivered.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Tracey

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Franklin County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Franklin County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Franklin County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
This is the data that I have for our UOF incidents. 2021 is the earliest that I have data for but not in the spreadsheet format. I did pull our statistics tables from our CALEA accreditation that we provide each year. Those reports show numbers for 2021 and 2022, then the excel spreadsheet is maintained and is from 2023 – current.

Thank you,

[star]

Sergeant Megan Huston
Public Relations | Public Information Officer | Accreditation Manager
Office of the Sheriff – County of Franklin
70 East Court Street | Rocky Mount, VA 24151
Office: 540-482-6691

The Office of the Sheriff is a Nationally Accredited Agency through the Commission on Accreditation for Law Enforcement Agencies (CALEA)

title: Ring Camera Surveillance

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Ring Camera Surveillance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documentation on the usage of Ring cameras and/or Neighbors app in surveillance, policing and social media/technology including, but not limited to, the following:

- Memorandum(s) of Understanding
- Initial Bid Documents
- Requests for Proposals
- Any privacy impact assessments
- Any instructional materials or presentations
- Use policies and standard operating procedures
- Data retention policies
- Letters of Interest
- Usage policies
- a Ring acknowledgement form completed by the agency (a copy of this completed form by the Livermore Police Department is attached to this request for reference)
- Any informal agreements that reference Ring, Neighbors, Amazon, or otherwise guide it use or the relationship between this agency and the provider or developer of the camera and/or software.

I further request Records sufficient to show all submissions made of Private Video Surveillance Registration form. For reference, I've linked a the Fremont Police Private Video Surveillance Registration page available on the Fremont Police website (as of 01/18/2026). Here is the link to the website: https://www.fremontpolice.gov/crime-prevention/video-surveillance-cameras/private-video-surveillance-cameras

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bryan Tor

communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] City of Fremont public records request #26-119
communications.communication:
City of Fremont ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #26-119 along with the following message: This message is in response to your request to the City of Fremont for public records. Notwithstanding the exemptions stated below, the City has located records that the City believes may be responsive to your request or of interest to you that the City can disclose. Those documents are included with this message.    To the extent that the requests seek information that falls within the deliberative process privileges and official information privilege, these records are exempt from disclosure under Government Code §§ 7927.705 and 7922.000 and Evidence Code §1040.   To the extent the requests seek information that is documented in copyrighted work or contain copyrighted work, federal law limits the reproduction by the City under the Copyright Act, 17 USC § 101 et seq. The City requires a waiver or permission from the copyright owner before reproducing copyrighted works. To the extent the request seeks information in documents containing business or industry information protected by the trade secret privilege, the City cannot disclose the information pursuant to Civil Code § 3426.1. To the extent that the request seeks records containing personal information, including identifiable health information, or information that constitutes an unwarranted invasion of a person’s privacy interest, such as credit card information, this information is exempt from disclosure under Government Code §§ 7927.700 and 7923.700.  To the extent that the requests seek documents that are information provided to the City by private individuals showing security measure around their residences, these records are exempt from disclosure under Government Code § 7927.500 because the public interest in non-disclosure of the personal security measures outweighs the public interest in disclosure because providing official information to the City should not negate the security of private individuals as this information could be used to thwart those measures and endanger the residents.   If there are records you feel should be disclosed notwithstanding this response, or you would like to discuss your requests and this response further, please respond using this portal. * signed ring agreement.pdf * Ring Presentation 021220.pdf-redacted.pdf Document links are valid for one month. After February 28, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Fremont.

title: Records Identifying Authorized Recipient for Service of Process – Candlewood Point Homeowners Tax District

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Identifying Authorized Recipient for Service of Process – Candlewood Point Homeowners Tax District
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I respectfully request copies of any records maintained by the Office of Policy and Management relating to the Candlewood Point Homeowners Tax District that identify the person, office, or agent authorized to accept service of process, including any records that specify an official address or designated recipient for service of process.

This request seeks only copies of existing records and does not request explanations, interpretations, or legal advice.

Thank you.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Thomas Pace

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request OPM ID # 26-05
communications.communication:
Re:        Freedom of Information Request OPM ID # 26-05

Dear Michael Thomas Pace:

Thank you for your Freedom of Information (FOI) request. This office is in receipt of your FOI request. We will canvass this agency for any responsive documents which are not otherwise exempt from disclosure.

Please note that Connecticut General Statutes (C.G.S.) § 1-212 permits public agencies to charge fees for copies of public records based upon statutory guidelines related to the original format of the records. According to C.G.S. § 1-212(c), a public agency may require the prepayment of any fee required or permitted under the Freedom of Information Act if such fee is estimated to be ten dollars or more.   We will provide you with an estimate of costs prior to copying.

As soon as we have additional information regarding your request, we will contact you.

Sincerely,
Legal Affairs - Office of Policy and Management



_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
This transmittal may be a confidential or may otherwise be privileged. If it is not clear that you are the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that you have received this transmittal in error; any review, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this transmittal is strictly prohibited. If you suspect that you have received this communication in error, please notify us immediately by e-mail at OPM.FOI@ct.gov<mailto:OPM.FOI@ct.gov> and immediately delete this message and all its attachments.

title: ALPR Hot Lists (Renton Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: ALPR Hot Lists (Renton Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.	A description of all “hot lists” or “custom hot lists” currently maintained for use in Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) systems.
2.	Any policies, agreements, or data-sharing documents identifying external data sources used to populate those lists (e.g., DMV data on suspended/revoked licenses, NCIC, CLETS, Amber Alerts, stolen vehicle databases).
3.	The criteria under which plates are added or removed from hot lists.

Please provide documents in native electronic form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Please note: Axon and Genetec/AutoVu have the ability for our agency to add custom hotlists; however, we have never done so with either program. We have only utilized Flock's custom hotlist, which was provided in the First Installment. 
  
The Second & Final Installment of records responsive to your request is available now on the City of Renton Public Records Center and includes: Contracts & Addendums (if applicable) with Axon, Flock, Genetec, and PCS Mobile, Axon ALPR FAQs (See Page 6) that advises NCIC/State Hotlist is updated four times per day (every six hours), ACCESS Manual Chapter 32-Vehicle File (See Page 6) that provides the Retention Periods for Vehicles for the Hotlist, Renton PD's Policy 536: NCIC Validations, and the WSP Access Manual Introduction: Quality Control and Validations that helps explain how an agency can remove a vehicle from the NCIC/State Hotlist, and is provided without exemption and/or redaction.

title: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Dillon Bergin.

title: Shared Care Tax Credit Statistics

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Shared Care Tax Credit Statistics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Information related to the Shared Care Tax Credit from as far back as data systems will allow through 2025. Specifically, the following information, as it is available:

1) Number of returns that claimed the credit
2) Total amount of credits claimed ($)
3) If available, (1) and (2) separately by taxpayer characteristics, such as filing status, marital status, age of taxpayer, AGI range, number of dependents, etc.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

title: Child care provider data

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Child care provider data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Additionally, I request databases or information related to all child care grants available in Pennsylvania since 2020. 

Specifically, I request the following information on all licensed child care providers as it is available:

1) Provider name or ID
2) Street number
3) Street name
4) City
5) Zip code
6) Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7) Enrollment for each year (by child age group, classroom, and/or subsidy status if available), as well as the number of teachers and aides in each classroom measured in full-time equivalent units
8) Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9) First license issue (open) date
10) Most recent license issue date
11) Most recent license expiration date or close date
12) Ages served for each year
13) Hours of operation for each year
14) QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15) Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16) Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17) Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18) Violation records
19) Information on ownership structure
20) For-profit status
21) NAEYC accreditation status

I also request the following information on all provider grant recipients at the child care grant-to-provider level, as it is available:

1) Provider name or ID
2) Street number
3) Street name
4) City
5) Zip code
6) Licensed capacity at the time of the grant application for each grant round
7) Amount awarded for each grant round

Additionally, if available, information on the process of applying for the grants, information on the process of allocating the grants, and information about rejected applications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Tracie Jarrett Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails between Tracie Jarrett and @hsi.dhs.gov email addresses since March 1, 2025, including attachments and associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Cecil County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Cecil County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Here is what our RMS has for Use of Force synopsis.   Last column has a glitch.  If actual use of force reports are needed, we will have to go through legal and then determine an estimated cost as years of reports will have to be pulled and reviewed.

title: Qualified Caregiving Expense Credit Tax Statistics

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Qualified Caregiving Expense Credit Tax Statistics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information related to the Qualified Caregiving Expense Credit from as far back as data systems will allow through 2025. Specifically, the following information, as it is available:

1) Number of returns that claimed the credit
2) Total amount of credits claimed ($)
3) If available, (1) and (2) separately by taxpayer characteristics, such as filing status, marital status, age of taxpayer, AGI range, number of dependents, etc.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: Formal Acknowledgement | Georgia Open Records Act Request: Qualified Caregiving Expense Credit Tax Statistics
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Georgia Department of Revenue. Please allow this to serve as the Department's initial response to and formal acknowledgement of your open records request.

The Department will attempt to provide all requested records, but due to confidentiality law, it is possible that some items may not be disclosed. Pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70 et seq., the Department will provide our formal response within 10 business days.

Under Georgia law, an agency may impose a reasonable charge for the search, redaction, and production or copying cost of records responsive to an Open Records Request. The time and cost will be calculated by using the hourly salary of the lowest paid employee qualified to conduct the research of an Open Records Request, with no charge for the first fifteen minutes of employee time expended. DOR will provide an estimate to the requestor if the reasonably anticipated costs for Production Tasks exceed $25 and will defer the Production Tasks until the requestor agrees to pay estimated costs.

Public Information Office
Georgia Department of Revenue
2595 Century Parkway, NE | Atlanta, GA 30345
Email: ORR@dor.ga.gov<mailto:ORR@dor.ga.gov>
Phone: 678-536-9348
dor.georgia.gov

communications.subject: GADOR Formal Response | Georgia Open Records Act Request: Qualified Caregiving Expense Credit Tax Statistics
communications.communication:
Below is a table addressing the first and second questions posed in your open records request.  The Department of Revenue does not track filing status, AGI, number of dependents or other taxpayer characteristics pertaining to taxpayers that claimed this credit.  O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(j) (“No public officer or agency shall be required to prepare new reports, summaries, or compilations not in existence at the time of the request.”).  In some cases, taxpayers may not have had a large enough liability to fully utilize the credits generated.  Hence, the claimed amount is less than the generated amount.  Data for 2025 is not yet available.

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Qualified Caregiving Expense Credit Tax Statistics
communications.communication:
Thank you very much for your help with my request. I have one follow-up question- what is the difference between "Credit Generated" and "Credit Claimed on Returns"?

Thanks,
Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: Follow Up | Georgia Open Records Act Request: Qualified Caregiving Expense Credit Tax Statistics
communications.communication:
Ms. Pepin,

Generally speaking, the difference is as follows:


  *   Credit Generated: Total amount of credit a taxpayer is eligible for during a specific period.
  *   Credit Claimed: Credit amount a taxpayer applies against their tax liability.
     *   A taxpayer may not be able to claim the full amount generated if their tax liability is lower than the credit amount, or if there is a statutory cap on credits.

I’ve attached the tax credit summary document posted to DOR’s website to the extent it’s helpful to you.

Public Information Office
Georgia Department of Revenue
2595 Century Parkway, NE | Atlanta, GA 30345
Email: ORR@dor.ga.gov<mailto:ORR@dor.ga.gov>
dor.georgia.gov

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Martin County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Martin County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: First Amendment Trainings for Law-Enforcement Officers (San Antonio Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: First Amendment Trainings for Law-Enforcement Officers (San Antonio Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any materials or programming (including handouts, slideshows, videos, textbooks, or other media) used in connection with providing training or guidance to law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the following subjects: (a) The First Amendment; (b) protests or demonstrations; (c) freedom of speech or expression; (d) filming police officers. This request is limited to materials used in trainings since January 1, 2020.

2. Any policy concerning whether trainings on the topics mentioned in (1) are mandatory, or regulating the frequency of such trainings.

3. A copy of any document sufficient to show the most recent training conducted for law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the subjects in (1). For example, this could be a receipt or contract for an outside vendor or speaker, or it could be a dated sign-in sheet from the training.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: W725891-090425
communications.communication:
Dear Adam  Steinbaugh: 
 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of San Antonio. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 9/4/2025 and given the reference number W725891-090425 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s). You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
In accordance with the Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, the City of San Antonio makes all of its public records available to citizens. 
 
The Public Information Act does not require governmental bodies to create new information, perform legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. The City of San Antonio will not comply with a standing request for information to be collected or prepared in the future. 
 
The City of San Antonio will respond within ten business days following submission of requests. The City of San Antonio may collect a fee as prescribed by law for the requested documents. For more information on the Texas Public Information Act, please visit the Texas Attorney General Web site at www.oag.state.tx.us/open/og_faqs.shtml. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center. 
 
 
 
Notice: 
 
The City’s AD 1.31 was signed on December 12, 2024. The City informed the Office of the Attorney General of the update on January 9, 2025. The City will implement the changes starting January 21, 2025. 
1. Texas Government Code Section 552.234(c) (the Texas Public Information Act) allows a governmental body to designate one mailing address and one electronic mail address for receiving written requests for public information. The City of San Antonio Administrative Directive 1.31, entitled Open Government, now provides the following methods to requestors seeking records from the City: 
a. Via email: openrecords@sanantonio.gov 
b. Via the open government portal: https://sanantonio.govqa.us/webapp/_rs/(S(nzhdsq2jtkns5hfojy5kcmbj))/supporthome.aspx (http:) 
c. By mail to the City: Open Records Division of the City of San Antonio, P.O. Box 839966, San Antonio, Texas 78283. 
d. By mail to San Antonio Police Department: 315 S. Santa Rosa, San Antonio, Texas 78207. 
e. By mail to San Antonio Fire Department: 315 S. Santa Rosa, San Antonio, Texas 78207. 
f. Note, hand-delivery and in-person requests are permitted under the Act. 
2. The City is not required to respond to a written request for public information unless the request is received by one of the methods listed above (Texas Government Code Section 552.205).

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #W725891-090425
communications.communication:
Hello --

I am writing to follow up on this request. While the Department provided a copy of an Attorney General letter ruling from 2018, it's unclear how that ruling bears on the instant request. To the contrary, the ruling suggests that records of Department policies and manuals are not per se confidential. Further, it's unclear how a ruling about a given manual relates to the instant request, which presumably seeks different records.

Please advise.

Thank you,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Cease and desist letters sent to Kalshi, Polymarket, and Crypto.com
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Electronic copies of the cease and desist letters sent to Kalshi, Polymarket, and Crypto.com.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Maurice Bransfield.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Cease and desist letters sent to Kalshi, Polymarket, and Crypto.com
communications.communication:
Mr. Hoover:

I have to deny your public records request as you have not presented proof of Tennessee citizenship.  Under the Tennessee Public Records Act, only citizens of Tennessee have the right to inspect and receive copies of public records. “All state, county and municipal records shall, at all times during business hours … be open for personal inspection by any citizen of this state, and those in charge of the records shall not refuse such right of inspection to any citizen, unless otherwise provided by state law.”  Tenn. Code Ann. § 10-7-503(a)(2)(A). Additionally, Sports Wagering Council (“SWC”) Rule 1350-04-.04(7) provides: “Proof of Tennessee citizenship, by presentation of a valid Tennessee driver’s license (or alternative acceptable form of ID as determined by the PRRC), is required as a condition to inspect or receive copies of public records and must be presented with the request.”



Thank you

Public Records Request Coordinator
Tennessee Sports Wagering Council
312 Rosa L Parks Ave., 8th Floor
Nashville, TN 37243

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Chesterfield County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Chesterfield County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe.

Chesterfield County FOIA Request Office

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Safety/Emergency Services Records Request :: P018433-012926
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Good morning Mr. Nash, Attached in the portal for your review are the records responsive to your request for "Use of Force Data".  Some of the information is being withheld pursuant to Virginia Code 2.2-3706(B)(9) because it is part of the records of administrative investigations. Additionally, because the Chesterfield County Sheriff's Office is not the primary Law Enforcement agency in Chesterfield, "uses of force" are generally situations arising out of the Chesterfield County Jail, in the Courthouse, etc.  Our office tracks all levels of force by an individual, whether that individual is a deputy, a citizen or an inmate, however, the system does not track which individual used the force in question. Thank you

title: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: City of Follansbee, WV Opiod Settlement Funds Spring 2026

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: City of Follansbee, WV Opiod Settlement Funds Spring 2026
communications.communication:
Jessica Riley 
1511 University Avenue, P.O. Box 6010
Morgantown, WV 26506-6010
January 23, 2026 

Christine Manack-Stover
City Manager
Follansbee City
872 Main Street
Follansbee, WV 26037

Dear Christine Manack-Stover:
Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that pertain to Follansbee’s opioid settlement funds. Specifically, I am requesting: 
- Documentation of the amount of funds the city has received from the federal opioid lawsuit settlements
- The application forms that any organization would submit to receive settlement funds
- Documentation of how much city-level funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded
- Any completed application of an organization that has received settlement funds from the city
- Documentation of the process by which funds are awarded
- Any documents that contain the names of the individuals who review the funding applications and determine the awards
- Any documents that account for future plans from the city for the use of opioid settlement funds
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how the opioid settlement funds are being spent. I am a student journalist whose request is strictly for news-gathering purposes. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 
The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. 
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 
Thank you for considering my request. 

Sincerely, Jessica Riley 
330-978-8228
jlr00026@mix.wvu.edu

communications.subject: RE: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: City of Follansbee, WV Opiod Settlement Funds Spring 2026
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following West Virginia Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 23, 2026. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: City of Follansbee, WV Opiod Settlement Funds Spring 2026
communications.communication:
As I previously stated, we do not receive much in Opioid funds.  We do not distribute to other agencies.

The City of Follansbee received $4291.93 in 2025 and we spent $3362.30 on body camera’s for our police officers.

Feel free to reach out if this does not answer your question

Ms. Chris Manack-Stover
Follansbee City Manager
City Main: (304) 527-1330
872 Main Street
Follansbee, WV 26037
www.thecityoffollansbee.com<http://www.thecityoffollansbee.com/>

title: Val Peterson

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Val Peterson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Frederick Valdemar Erastus Peterson, aka Val Peterson (July 18, 1903 - October 17, 1983). Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago. Peterson served as governor of Nebraska from 1947 to 1953, head of the Federal Civil Defense Administration from February 19, 1953 to June 14, 1957, ambassador to Denmark from August 22, 1957 to February 21, 1961, and ambassador to Finland from July 14, 1969 to March 23, 1973.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

Supporting documentation

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your

public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your

you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the

title: FL Police Employment Data

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FL Police Employment Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

This is a public records request made via MuckRock under Florida Statutes Chapter 119, seeking records related to law enforcement officer certification in this state.

This request is brought by Invisible Institute, a nonprofit public accountability journalism organization based in Chicago.

This request seeks the following:

• Up-to-date versions of the spreadsheets regarding certified officers (including all types of officers certified by FDLE), employment history, sustained disciplinary actions at the department level, and FDLE certification cases previously released under PRR-2023-14

• To the extent it is not included in the above bullet point, all underlying data tables from FDLE's CJSTC Disciplinary database, available here: https://atms.fdle.state.fl.us/atms/od/searchOD.jsf

• In addition, please include the ORI number for the employing agency for all officers in any spreadsheets of employment history or disciplinary actions

If FDLE withholds or redacts any information, please provide the specific provision of the law being used to withhold or redact that information. AHCA is also likely aware of the attorneys’ fees provisions of Fla. Stat. section 119.12 (2020).

Please email the documents or files, and any communications, to foia@invisibleinstitute.com. Please acknowledge and respond to my request promptly and in good faith, pursuant to Section
119.07(1)(c), F.S. Cf. Hewlings v. Orange County, 87 So. 3d 839 (Fla. 5th DCA 2012). As the Attorney General’s Government in the Sunshine Manual instructs, “The only delay in producing
records permitted under Ch. 119, F.S., ‘is the limited reasonable time allowed the custodian to retrieve the record and delete those portions of the record the custodian asserts are exempt.’”

Invisible Institute is an award-winning nonprofit public accountability journalism organization based in Chicago. Our mission is to enhance the capacity of citizens to hold public institutions accountable. Because I, the requestor, am a journalist, and I seek the information in order to disseminate it to the public, and because the information regards the safety, welfare, and legal rights of the general public, I request a fee waiver for this data. It is not for commercial benefit because I am a member of the nonprofit news media whose principal purpose is to access and disseminate information regarding the general public’s safety, welfare, and legal rights. To the extent you intend to assess any charges, please notify me to discuss first. Please limit any assessed fees to the “actual cost of duplication,” which means “the cost of the material and supplies used to duplicate the public record, but does not include labor cost or overhead cost associated with such duplication” (Fla. Stat. § 119.011(1)). 

Thank you for your time and prompt attention to this matter. Please contact me should you have any questions related to this request.

Sam Stecklow
Invisible Institute
Experimental Station
6100 South Blackstone Avenue
Chicago, Illinois 60637
foia@invisibleinstitute.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sam Stecklow

communications.subject: Confirmation of Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Florida Department of Law Enforcement Office of Open Government. This message is being provided as confirmation your message was received. You should receive a response to your inquiry as soon as possible.



If you need criminal history records, please visit our website, https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/Criminal-History-Records/Obtaining-Criminal-History-Information.aspx, and/or contact FDLE’s Criminal History Services Section at ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us> or (850) 410-8161.



Public records requests are processed in the order that they are received. Processing time may be lengthened due to the nature and extent of the request. Searches may be negative and FDLE may not have records responsive to your public records request. You may also receive an invoice for your request depending on the nature and extent of your public records request. Please feel free to contact us at (850) 410-7676, or publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us>, if you have additional specific information relating to the records you are requesting, as this may help expedite your request and/or reduce costs that may be associated with the request.



Additional information regarding how to obtain public records including what costs may be applicable is contained from the hyperlink below. We are committed to our fundamental values of Service, Integrity, Respect, and Quality.



For Additional Information click here: Open Government (state.fl.us)<https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/Open-Government>

communications.subject: FW: Public Records Request Confirmation Receipt, FDLE Docket No. PRR-2025-2383
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Stecklow:

Thank you for contacting the Florida Department of Law Enforcement’s Public Records Section. Your tracking number is PRR-2025-2383.

Public records requests are processed in the order that they are received. Processing time may be lengthy due to the nature and extent of the request. Searches may be negative and FDLE may not have records responsive to your public records request. You may also receive an invoice for your request depending on the nature and extent of your public records request. A copy of the FDLE Guide to Public Records is attached for your review.

Please be advised that FDLE may not be the custodian of all of the records you requested. FDLE is not the custodian of all State of Florida criminal incident-related records for every state and local criminal justice agency.

Additional information regarding how to obtain public records including what costs may be applicable may be found on our website http://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx .

We are committed to our fundamental values of Service, Integrity, Respect, and Quality.

If you have questions concerning your request, please contact us at (850) 410-7676 or publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us>, and please include your “PRR” docket number we’ve provided above.

Sincerely,

Office of Open Government – Public Records Section

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Liberty County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Liberty County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Re: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
The Freedom of Information Act ("FOIA") Office of Eastern Michigan
University (“EMU”) has received your 1/7/2026 Michigan FOIA request (received
on 1/8/2026).


This email serves as notification that due to the current volume of
requests and limited University resources, EMU is extending the response
due date by ten (10) business days, as allowed by MCL15.235 of the Act
(attached) and will respond by 1/29/2026.


For further information on EMU's Procedures & Guidelines regarding FOIA,
please visit our website at
https://www.emich.edu/legal-affairs/foia/index.php

Best,
*Jordan D. Miller* | Assistant General Counsel
*Eastern Michigan University*
Legal Affairs
11 Welch Hall | Ypsilanti, MI 48197
Direct:  734-487-8431 | Main: 734-487-1055
Email:   jmill251@emich.edu

Notice: This message may be privileged and confidential and protected from
disclosure. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified
that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is
strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error,
please notify me immediately via email, and delete it from your computer.

I'm following up on the following Michigan Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 7, 2026. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Jan. 29, 2026. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.

communications.subject: Re: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Your request is granted in part.  Attached please find existing responsive
records.  Signatures have been redacted from documents pursuant to Section
13(1)(a) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, which allows a public
body to refrain from disclosing information that would constitute an
unwarranted invasion of an individual's privacy.

Should you choose to appeal EMU's redactions, you may do one of the
following at your option, pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information
Act (MCL15.235 Sec. 5):

1.  Submit to the University President a written appeal that specifically
states the word “appeal” and identifies the reason(s) for the denial to be
reversed. You may email your appeal to: president@emich.edu; or you may
mail it to Eastern Michigan University   ATTN: President ~ 202 Welch
Hall ~ Ypsilanti,
MI 48197.

2.  Commence an action in the court of claims to compel the University’s
disclosure of the public records within 180 days after the final
determination to deny the request.  If you prevail, you may be awarded
costs and reasonable attorney’s fees. MCL15.240 Sec. 10(7) states: "If the
court determines in an action commenced under this section that the public
body has arbitrarily and capriciously violated this act by refusal or delay
in disclosing or providing copies of a public record, the court shall order
the public body to pay a civil fine of $1,000.00, which shall be deposited
into the general fund of the state treasury. The court shall award, in
addition to any actual or compensatory damages, punitive damages in the
amount of $1,000.00 to the person seeking the right to inspect or receive a
copy of a public record."

For further information on EMU's Procedures & Guidelines regarding FOIA,
please visit our website at http://www.emich.edu/legalaffairs/foia.php.

Thank you,

[image: Jordan Signature.PNG]
*Jordan D. Miller* | Assistant General Counsel
*Eastern Michigan University*
Legal Affairs
11 Welch Hall | Ypsilanti, MI 48197
Direct:  734-487-8431 | Main: 734-487-1055
Email:   jmill251@emich.edu

Notice: This message may be privileged and confidential and protected from
disclosure. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified
that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is
strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error,
please notify me immediately via email, and delete it from your computer.
